thread.title: Rosie O'Donnell Speaks Out About Her Daughter Chelsea's Shocking Tell-All Interview
thread.title_full: Rosie O'Donnell Speaks Out About Her Daughter Chelsea's Shocking Tell-All Interview

author: Cosmopolitan.com
title: Rosie O'Donnell Speaks Out About Her Daughter Chelsea's Shocking Tell-All Interview
text:
​In a statement to Entertainment Tonight, Rosie O'Donnell called her daughter Chelsea's interview with the ​Daily Mail ​" heartbreaking on every level ."
Earlier this week, Chelsea gave a long interview to the British tabloid, telling them she did not run away from home in August but was instead kicked out by her mom. The incident sparked a plea from Rosie on her social media sites to help find her daughter. Days later she was found in New Jersey with Steven Sheerer , ​ a man she met on Tinder with a history of drug-related arrests. ​ ​She was 17 at the time.
 ​Chelsea said after the police found her and brought her back home, her mother immediately sent her to live with a friend. Chelsea, who has since turned 18, successfully petitioned a judge to remove the no-contact order against Sheerer. ​ Chelsea told the ​Daily Mail ​she is now living with ​Sheerer ​and his family, and plans to move to Wisconsin with him to better get to know her biological family.
More From Cosmopolitan In the interview , Chelsea also revealed numerous personal details about growing up with Rosie, telling the publication her mother was a different person in the public eye. She also disputed her mother's claim that she was mentally ill and said a lot of people "struggle" with what she has.
" ​ I find her not genuine a lot of the time," she said of her mom. "When we'd go out, she was a completely different person in public than at home and I had a hard time with that. It's like two different people."
Rosie has so far not addressed the specific claims made in the ​Daily Mail article. ​On Wednesday morning, she tweeted a photo of her children and a Quote: from ​ Margaret Wise Brown's The Runaway Bunny.
“I will grow, I will grow, I will grow.
I will grow without you. I will feel
the sun on my face and I will thrive.” pic.twitter.com/yVvR0iUxpb
— Rosie (@Rosie) October 7, 2015
​The Quote: reads " I will grow, I will grow, I will grow. I will grow without you. I will feel the sun on my face and I will thrive."
​Follow Rebecca on Instagram .
